website_summaries.verdict: A bright and versatile diving light that is designed to be used for your underwater photography.
pros: This underwater light is adaptable to fit a number of different cameras, both action cameras and SLRs
It features 84 LED lights, which can be used in high, mid, low, or strobe settings
In the low-light mode, the battery will last approximately 5 hr
cons: Other than a rare faulty unit slipping through to the consumer, Suptig's dive light doesn't have any consistent flaws

customer_reviews.title: Died the first dive.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this light while it was working, but half way through my first dive it stopped working. I could no longer switch modes or turn off the light. After the battery died the light of course went off. Once it was fully recharged, the blue indicator lights on the back were all lit but I could not turn on the light. They have been on for two days but I still cannot turn on the light. It did not leak as far as I can tell. It seems electronic. What a shame since it was doing a great job before dying.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned after only 4 dives
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this light - plenty bright (can be used during daylight dives also), the adjustable lighting is awesome (I was using the lowest level with great results), battery life was very good. Unfortunately during the 4th dive, the on/off switch malfunctioned and no longer able to turn it off. Tried draining the battery and allowing to dry out completely but still locked in "on" mode - guessing its a malfunction of the mechanical switch. Bought 6 months ahead of dive vacation so no chance to return. Big disappointment - wish it had worked.
customer_reviews.author: WineDiver

customer_reviews.title: After 3rd dive,  i was not able to turn off or change intensity .
customer_reviews.text: once it got dry, start to work again. It is really bad this issue. I cant get back to the boat with the light ON. so every body in the boat was claiming to me. There is no way to turn ligth off so i have to hide the equipment inside my bags to avoid the issue. i will try to retun this item today.
customer_reviews.author: DMel

customer_reviews.title: Hella Good for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: These are for underwater work but I don't see why they couldn't be used in open air. Overall great units. Average battery life that we have been getting is about 10-12 hours which is nice, Depending on the amount of ambient light that is available then the adjustment of low-med-high works pretty well. There are times that where you need full power and then the image gets washed out or you go with medium and then the image is too dark. Part of the learning curve with underwater photography I guess. One other thing, a little silicone grease on the threads and o-ring on the plug that you remove for access to the charging port is very very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JustaDudeTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life, but not bright enough.
customer_reviews.text: We were able to use this on our dives last week. It attaches well to the GoPro. Our dives averaged about 70 minutes each, and the battery did not run out and charged back up each night. It just isn't bright enough. It does not illuminate like the pictures in the ads show. It was basically no help in the 30 foot depth we dive at. I cannot say if it would help at deeper, darker depths.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light last year and it stopped working after a couple of dives. The company replaced it but the replacement also stopped working after a couple of dives.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it leaks and fails.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until it leaked and failed on the 4th use. The gasket around the lens is fairly sturdy, but unfortunately the on/off/mode switch was not up to the task, and it's seal failed and allowed water into the light. I opened it up, dried it out and sealed it back up, and it did work again, but eventually the leak became too aggressive. Buy something else that's more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Mount failed
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this product is worth buying. The mount for it is plastic and is attached to the base with 2 very tiny screws which pulled out of the plastic on the first dive. The unit itself is positive buoyant so it floated up. Now the mount has to be replaced since it not worth fixing. Poor design. Not sure where the manufacture comes up with 1500 lumens when next to another manufacture's 900 lumen light it is not as bright. Not sure who's is correct but the 900 is definitely brighter then this unit. I'm sure I could not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoe1840

customer_reviews.title: 30 feet water resistant and not 164 foot water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Well it says that its 164 foot resistant and i just went diving for second time to 40 foot max dive and water went in now the light doesn’t work at all the dive before was 30 feet and no problem so it is a 30 feet water resistant thats why am not giving more than one star
customer_reviews.author: Zullyn

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS!!! Leaked first time in the water
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip I took to Bonaire in January. I’m a long time scuba diver so know fully the need for properly sealing things like camera housings and in this case this light. Took it for the first dive and within a minute, the light stopped working. After the dive, it was apparent the light flooded. It would appear the water entered the light via the cap that covers the USB port used for charging the light. I had that cap off, charged it, even lubricating the O ring before replacing it, water still was able to enter the light. The light is junk now. Avoid this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Salem Photog

customer_reviews.title: 😎💨👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good flood light I love to use this thing on recreational Dives haven't used it yet for Dryland type photography but I would definitely recommend it for recreational diving it says it goes 163 ft but I've never gone that far yet with it maybe I'll give a second review when I get to that diving level😅😅
customer_reviews.author: Israel Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: I have used this light on 14 dives (2 night, 12 day) so far and it works great with my action camera. Gives true color pictures at any depth, day or night with my action camera without a red filter. On night dives it has been the brightest light in the group. Everyone with a camera wanted me to swim over to give them good lighting for their pictures.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: For the money, this light is great!!
customer_reviews.text: I took this light down 100' in Grand Cayman for a couple of dives. It really lights up the crevices and overhangs that are so difficult to see under. GoPro pics came out great. You have to take care with the housing mounts as they feel brittle and seem if you torque them too much they will break. I had no issues with it though and feel it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent light for price
customer_reviews.text: Used this for Scuba diving, worked fine on all dives so far. Took it down to 81ft and had no issues. The one thing you should note is that you have to be within 20-24 inches close to your subject the further you descend for the light to have an effect on your subject if you'll be using it for scuba. It's a relatively inexpensive 1st option to start if you don't want to break the bank on pro lights
customer_reviews.author: blxamz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fill light for video while SCUBA diving...
customer_reviews.text: I use a pair of these lights to flood the subjects I film while diving. I have used the lights up to 80' (24m) with no issues and the deeper you go, the more you appreciate being able to replace the light (and color) lost at depth. I turn them on at the start of a dive and off at the end and get 2 hours of runtime out of each light. It's pretty easy to buy flexible arms, mounts, and bars to make a nice camera rig for not much money. Love these lights!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Changed the mount to less useful - charging plug designed to fail
customer_reviews.text: The charging system with a micro USB is destined to fail. The mounting bracket was a flat, glue down. Now it must be cut and fit to be useful. Worth about what you pay for it as a dry-land light that will fail within 10 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Research Team

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this LED light. I’ve had it for almost a full month and after one drop the battery inside has come loose. Not only that there are times it doesn’t charge, the battery pack rattles inside and is noisy when moving the light around. It does have good lighting but I would not recommend this light, it’s pricy and is made out of a poor material.
customer_reviews.author: maria agustina

customer_reviews.title: Working like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked the out side case to have been a more solid material so that I know it’s ok for my dives. I’ve taken it down to 30ft and it’s worked as advertised. I’ll have some deeper dives to come so we’ll see if it can go down to 120+. But if your just using it on the surface it’s very light weight which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: JBCook

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, save ur money
customer_reviews.text: A total waste of money, or should i say a good theft?. I bought it twice. First time: used first time diving, and then for second use just didnt worked and starting turning of and on, then just it did what ever it wants, even not charging sometimes. Sencond time i use it for two divinga, batery drained all, and then when trying to charge it starts to turn off and on, and then after 2 jours it charges nornally bet u cant turn it on, if its off, or u cant turnit off, if its on. Just crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro C.

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed my light, its extremely bright and seems to look pretty good. The housing seems to be a little on the cheap side but I have yet to use it under water yet. 5 stars for now but will be back once I test.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Bright light
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable and super bright this is amazing I’ve ordered four after the first purchase need them for small projects and monitoring. They fit on universal mounts and come equipped wit all you need for basic operations.
customer_reviews.author: BRAVO

customer_reviews.title: These are okay to the price
customer_reviews.text: These lights works great for an hours dive filming on my GoPro but not at distance only close.
customer_reviews.author: TheSailingDane

customer_reviews.title: Good light til low cost. Testet in 20 dives down to max 30 m.
customer_reviews.text: I have now had 20 dives with two of these lights mounted on the camera rig. They work perfectly. Gets good light at 20-40cm. daytime distance and they illuminate the entire area at night or if you are in a dark wreck. Cheap and very good. Lights up approx. 90 minutes at full power.
customer_reviews.author: Terje

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, very bright
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use on my paddle board for evening paddles. Slows me down a little with drag, but not worried because I am taking my time and enjoying the sites. I also used these on my dive mask. Very bright, and as long as you follow instruction for under water use, you will be just fine. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Leo &  Kristen Repetti

customer_reviews.title: Not bright
customer_reviews.text: While it seems to be bright on dry land....it made almost no difference underwater. I had to get the light within inches of the reef to see the light
customer_reviews.author: A. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Has worked well so far
customer_reviews.text: I have used this both underwater and above for filming with my gopro. It has held up well so far. I haven't taken it very deep yet but 30' has caused no problems at all. The battery seems to last a good while as well.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Mixed results
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One failed after 3-4 uses and other is still going.
customer_reviews.author: stanmag

customer_reviews.title: all round great product
customer_reviews.text: can be used above and below water so i fully endorse it to anyone who does film.
customer_reviews.author: chowoz

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectation. Excellent quality. Easy to use and recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Don Franklin

customer_reviews.title: To bright.
customer_reviews.text: It’s almost to bright for what I use it for 😂
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I’m not going under water so it’s good and it bright !!
customer_reviews.author: Keaira

customer_reviews.title: Terrible attachment quality
customer_reviews.text: Boot to attach to camera broke before I even got into the water. The light seems alright, but what’s the point if the attachment is absolutely terrible? Do no recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zac E.

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This product failed on the first dive, I guess you get what you pay for. I bought two of these lights and one works well the other failed after first use, and I wasn't diving very deep maybe 50 feet. Well within the parameters of the product. Do yourself a favor and spend more money on a better product.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Left the cap off and it flooded
customer_reviews.text: The light worked great, the problem is the design of the charging port. It's way to easy to forget to put it back on. if you forget and jump in the water your light is dead! Pissed me off because otherwise it's a good light
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Will not turn off
customer_reviews.text: Unable to turn it off On diving trip now Would like to refund or replace This is a Galapagos trip of a lifetime and unit is malfunctioning
customer_reviews.author: Larry Shemen

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for one dive
customer_reviews.text: We were only able to use it for one dive before it quit working. It wouldn't turn on and then days later it turned on by it self and wouldn't turn off. We stayed at 90 ft so it was above the rated depth. The light it self was bright and great, wish it actually worked still.
customer_reviews.author: Elly Anderson

customer_reviews.title: does what it should and when it should
customer_reviews.text: Works well, great item for the price, really helps illuminate underwater shots....
customer_reviews.author: shibbopics

customer_reviews.title: Good underwater light for the price
customer_reviews.text: This light works good. I used it on a few bridge inspection dives to about 60 ft. Be careful when screwing the usb access plug back in, could cross thread pretty easily. Other than that no complaints. Battery life is good. For the price it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for dives
customer_reviews.text: Works well, used it at various depths in the ocean and no issues yet
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilske

customer_reviews.title: Good value for your money.
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a scuba dive and attached it to my goPro 3+. It added nice light to my pictures. My depth as around 90 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rees

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great article, took it diving, was bright and worked fine. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Navarrete B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for duck hunting
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for filming in the marsh on my duck hunts This photo was taken at 5am and lit it up very well
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: worked really well night scuba in the pool, used 2 of them, left and right to get some cool shots
customer_reviews.author: Joel A.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tested this device on dive until 15 meters. Everything is works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Max Graham

customer_reviews.title: Cave exploring
customer_reviews.text: Used this to explore queens bath on Big Island, works great! Would recommend one light per diver.
customer_reviews.author: Garner Family

customer_reviews.title: Good light
customer_reviews.text: Used in Hawaii for days and night dives. Good inexpensive light works perfect with GoPro.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: I just this light for duck hunting, so far it’s been great and stays charged for a long period of time and is super bright. Also love it because you can connect a go pro to it!
customer_reviews.author: laythe.montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless shore diving only
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a good light. Fit on my camera tray great. Second time I jumped in it broke off. Terrible design for anyone entering the ocean from a boat by giant stride.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks good, very bright, have not taken it diving yet so I can not comment on battery life or how waterproof it is.
customer_reviews.author: Pat O.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if it is for Diving
customer_reviews.text: Water resistant not the best after few dives start to act crazy and have water and moist in the screen inside and I am sure soon it will stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud Elmallah

customer_reviews.title: Works good, not the best cold shoe mount
customer_reviews.text: Works good but the cold shoe mount is not the best
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Totesau

customer_reviews.title: Great product I’m going to buy another
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything they say it is. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas C  Spellman

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof light.
customer_reviews.text: Have dove this light 50-60 times now to depths of 130’ and it has never failed me. Since purchasing I seen 5 of my dive friends order their own.
customer_reviews.author: thom1223

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent dive light for using with my GoPro. I bought two of them to allow light to come from two angles.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

164ft Waterproof(50M): Suptig underwater lights can waterproof 164ft(50M), You can shoot the photos and videos you want at the bottom of the sea to bring you the perfect visual effect. Even in heavy rains it will not affect the work of Suptig waterproof lights

Built-in lithium battery: Use The 2600Mha lithium battery, You can use the Micro USB cable at any time to charge. Suptig Diving lights used 84-leds high-brightness LED desing, Bright/wide angle light has 5000lux, Color temperature 5500k

4 lighting modes: Suptig light has 4 lighting modes, Satisfy you in different environments. High light modes: Use about 2.5 hours; Mid light modes: about 3.5 hours; Low light modes: about 5 hours; SOS modes: about 9 hours

Careful design: Use the Stainless steel material and ultra-durable PC material, Even if used in the deep sea, it will not rust. Unique patented design, Suptig Underwater lights size: 4.33 inchx 3.93 inch x 2.16inch. You can enjoy 24 months warranty and 30 days money back guarantee
